intro: Stobaea eriobasis, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to golden-orange inflorescences that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Stobaea eriobasis is known for its ability to thrive in a wide range of soil types and climates.
